postTextParagraphs: Full-Stack developer experienced in creating modern, robust, scalable and responsive websites and web applications, with an emphasis on user-experience.
I also have a solid background with linux server administration.
I love to learn new technologies, and enhance my skills.
Here is an overview of my skills, that I update frequently:

projects.title: Semantic searches on audio transcripts
projects.description: Script to create & store audio transcripts in vector db
postTextParagraphs: A project to perform semantic search on large volumes of audio transcripts.
It first gather audio files using yt-dlp, then create transcriptions via Whisper.cpp.
Then the transcriptions chunks are stored in a sql db, which will be used to create embeddings.
Finally, those embeddings will be stored in a vector DB

points.text: Gather files via yt-dlp from a single flux url
Transcriptions generated locally, no API used

projects.title: Portfolio Website / Reusable website structure
postTextParagraphs: When I built this website, I envisioned it as a kind of template for a website structure that could be used for many different projects.
This is a 1.0 version, and I'm planning to add new features along the way.

points.text: Reusable structure
Can be fed by a json file or a backend server for the app's text / projects elements
Ready to be connected to a backend
Use of Suspense, Fallback, ErrorBoundaries, react-router and framer-motion

projects.title: Kosmo Project
projects.description: An ideal social network for me. (In progress...)
postTextParagraphs: The idea behind this project was to create my ideal Twitter-like social network.
Since I felt frustrated by the absence of some features that are crucial to me in X/Twitter, I decided to channel that frustration into building something of my own.
For me, many features on Reddit are really well-designed and should be integrated into Twitter. I've drawn a lot of inspiration from it.
I don't take it too seriously for now though, I see it more as a portfolio project to show off a bit, rather than something that will release for real one day, but who knows ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

points.text: Meant to be a healthy social network
Upvote/downvote system
Built almost Vanilla. No libraries for managing animations / responsive / pages..

videos.text: A video showing off the project

images.text: Home page displaying posts in a column view, with the menu to create a post toggled.

projects.title: Temporo
projects.description: A simple and flexible app to manage timers and habits
postTextParagraphs: (This project was a sort of experience, I wanted to see if I could create a whole iOS app and post it to the appstore without writing a single line of code.)
It supports setting timers for cooking, creating countdowns for goals and events, and tracking workout sessions.
It is designed to be intuitive and flexible.
Timers can be customized with names, colors, icons, and categories. Progress can be monitored over time using a completion grid.

points.text: Timers of different types
Manage, sort and filter timers with categories, colors, name and more
Completion grid to track progress over time

projects.title: WebInsights
projects.description: A Chrome extension to get summaries and informations about websites. (In progress)
postTextParagraphs: It aims to be a simple Chrome extension that provides summaries and explanations using the context of the current webpage.
Initially, the idea behind this extension was to use Chrome's built-in Gemini Nano LLM, relying solely on a local LLM for inference within the app.
But.. this feature isn't widely available yet, so I added the option to enter an OpenAi API key and use gpt4o-mini instead.

points.text: Summaries using LLM
Flexible application structure
Sync the settings among the Chrome instances for a given Google account

postsLinks.linkName: See the current version online (in dev)

images.text: The summary page, with the choice of tones to use (that uses different prompts)
The setting page, where you can set a default tone, as well as setting up the api key

projects.title: Coaching section
projects.description: React web app to find coaches by topics
postTextParagraphs: It aims to be a pretty simple web app that needs to be fed with a JSON file containing coaches in different topics.
It allows clients to find the perfect coach for their needs.
Also it was my first React application
Client : Amazon

points.text: Fed with a JSON file
Filter items by topics

videos.text: A video showing of the project
